item.title: Minecraft HD!
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

Or like runescape advertised their new graphics update as “HD”
But what they really ment was high detal.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft HD!
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:392387”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=489559.msg3580005#msg3580005 date=1303716419]

‘HD’ is just anything greater than 720p right? So since my monitor goes up higher than 1080p I’ve been playing minecraft in higher than HD for quite some time now, did I just blow your mind?

Your monitor may be ‘HD’ but is the texture pack on minecraft ‘HD’? I’m sure you wouldn’t call 16/32 pixels per block ‘HD’.
[/quote]

I hate how people just randomly apply the term ‘HD’ to things, so I don’t think a texture pack could be HD. ;)[/quote]

Well I’ve never used a 1080p monitor so I would only guess that a program that displays 16x (with mods allowing for 32x and more) blocks would look a little less than “high definition”.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft HD!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:8, topic:392387”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=489559.msg3579975#msg3579975 date=1303713171]
‘HD’ is just anything greater than 720p right? So since my monitor goes up higher than 1080p I’ve been playing minecraft in higher than HD for quite some time now, did I just blow your mind?
[/quote]

Your monitor may be ‘HD’ but is the texture pack on minecraft ‘HD’? I’m sure you wouldn’t call 16/32 pixels per block ‘HD’.[/quote]

I hate how people just randomly apply the term ‘HD’ to things, so I don’t think a texture pack could be HD.

Read full topic
